title: Wasted screen space
creator: macster51
content:
I have used Thunderbird for years and I have previously donated. But in all these years there's one thing I never understood:|

Why all the wasted vertical space? 

It makes it difficult to use on a laptop when a third of the screen is used for basically nothing.

Advantages: All of the items in the options drop down could be buttons. (One click instead of click-drag-release click) You could easily make that area only one or two lines vertically by putting the Subject and List ID on the same row. And the yellow line about" blocking remote content": That could also just be a button instead of taking up 2 horizontal rows.

On my laptop it looks like this. (See image)

Thanks for listening! -mike

title: Signature seperator "-- " not shown when "below my reply (above the quote)" is used
creator: smart321y
content:
When a signature is used, activated and the option "below my reply (above the quote)" is used there is no signature separator "-- " used. This is contrary to the behavior when using "Signature below quoted" and a new message, where the separator is used. The solution should be to show the separator in all modes consistently.

(Adding the separator in the signature text definition is not a workaround, because the separator is then doubled in new messages)

Screenshot of the settings for problem replication is attached.

Используемый протокол: IMAP, SMTP

Адрес ящика: ksusha-prishedko@yandex.ru


Дата: 11.03.2025


Время: с 10:00 до 12:53

Описание: пытаюсь почту яндекса открыть в thunderdird . Протокол imap smtp. Выползает ошибка, не верный логин или пароль, уже проверяла и меняла. В почте яндекса "Разрешить доступ к почтовому ящику с помощью почтовых клиентов" все разрешено. Настройки в thunderdird: Входящая почта

Протокол — IMAP; Имя сервера — imap.yandex.ru (или imap.ya.ru, если вы подключаетесь не из России); Порт — 993; SSL — SSL/TLS; Аутентификация — «Обычный пароль".

Исходящая почта

Имя сервера — smtp.yandex.ru; Порт — 465; SSL — SSL/TLS; Аутентификация — «Обычный пароль».

title: Safe Attachments con Dynamic Delivery
creator: alessandro.masci1
content: Uso il client di posta Thunderbird per accedere tramite il protocollo IMAP a un account Office 365. Sul tenant è abilitato il "Safe Attachments" con Dynamic Delivery, pertanto il server exchange rimuove provvisoriamente l'allegato per l'analisi e lo rende disponibile dopo una ventina di secondi. Non ho problemi a ricevere messaggi con allegati provenienti da mittenti esterni. Se invece invio un messaggio contenente un allegato ad un utente esterno e a me stesso, il client Thunderbird scarica il messaggio nella posta in arrivo e al posto dell'allegato compare l'informazione "analisi degli allegati sicuri in corso", ma l'allegato non viene mai scaricato, anche a distanza di ore, anche chiudendo e riaprendo il client. E' come se Thuinderbird scaricasse il messaggio appena spedito e arrivato nella inbox e di conseguenza il messaggio in quel momento non contiene l'allegato che è sottoposto a scansione, successivamente non rileva che il messaggio è cambiato e non lo scarica nuovamente. Ovviamente il problema non si verifica se uso un client Outlook. E' un problema di incompatibilità tra Thunderbird e "Safe Attachments" con Dynamic Delivery, o è necessario agire su qualche impostazione a livello di configurazione client?
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/134.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Edg/134.0.0.0

title: Anomalia configurazione PEC - Thunderbird non da errori ma scaricando i messaggi non viene scaricata nessuna mail.
creator: marketing128
content: Siamo un'azienda che ha vari pc in cui si utilizza Thunderbird come client di posta. Su uno di questi sono inserite varie mail tra cui alcune PEC (posta certificata), vitali per l'azienda. Ci siamo accori che una di queste pec ha un'anomalia causata dal client di posta. Quando questa pec (green.design@legalmail.it) è stata configurata Thunderbird non ci ha segnalato errori di configurazione e infatti è stata impostata correttamente. Però per qualche motivo ha scaricato solo una mail dal server, come si vede dall'immagine allegata, anche se siamo a conoscenza che dalla webmail ci sono più mail al suo interno. La cosa ancor più strana è che Thunderbird quando si clicca su "Scarica Messaggi" si collega correttamente al server della pec ma non scarica alcuna mail e non restituisce alcun tipo di errore. Questo ha generato alla nostra società un grave problema perchè non ci ha permesso di visualizzare pec che dovevamo vedere tempo fa.

title: v136: Threads/Conversations Not Working
creator: jaydelotte
content:
I have View > Sort By > Threaded turned on, but email threads do not show my replies as separate emails in the chain (like Gmail or Outlook).

When I click on an email with replies, the Conversation command in my toolbar goes grey, and even if it didn't, I don't want to open a new tab for the conversation. I want the email, and all replies (from me and the sender) to show in the middle/header pane.

What I'd really like is to make Thunderbird look as much like Outlook as I can, but that doesn't seem to be possible without more effort than I'm willing to expend - but a thread that was actually threaded would be a good start.

Any suggestions?

title: Failure to copy emails from one account to another
creator: kmqbdaisy
content:
Running 128.8.0esr on Win 11. I have just created a new email account in my mailserver for a colleague and have also created it in my Thunderbird. I can see it on the server and in TB and everything seems OK - except that when trying to copy emails from my own account to the new one, I had success in copying over half of one folder (about 400 messages) and then TB refused to transfer any more, either to that new folder or to another in the new account. I shut down and restarted (more than once) and it's very weird. Sometimes it will let me copy one email over, at other times it won't copy anything, but will let me move a few emails to the new account inbox (from where I can move them into the correct folder) and then copy them back into the original folder. This is obviously not feasible when I need to share several hundred more messages into the new account!

I often shift messages around TB from one personal email account to another and have never had this problem. One oddity is that the new email account has placed itself right at the bottom of the left-hand pane, below Local Folders and the newsgroup account. This doesn't seem right but I can't move it to be next to the earlier email accounts.

Can anyone suggest what's going wrong? Or a work around? I need to share a lot of emails with my colleague while keeping them in my own folders too.

Kate (formerly known as ElviraKate but Mozilla seems to have lost me)
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:136.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/136.0
